text: Adam Tomek Sarota (born 28 December 1988) is an Australian footballer who plays as a central midfielder. ==Career== ===Club=== ====Brisbane Roar==== Sarota was named National Youth League Player of the Year for 2008–2009.Sydney FC snares youth title As a result of his solid performances for the Brisbane Roar youth team, he was rewarded with a first team contract prior to the 2009–10 A-League season.Sarota looks to push on On 2 November 2008 he made his A-League debut for the Brisbane Roar against the Newcastle Jets.Queensland Roar's Chris Grossman considers team switch ====Utrecht==== On 2 April 2010, along with fellow Brisbane Roar players, Michael Zullo and Tommy Oar, Sarota joined Dutch side Utrecht on a three-year deal, in a collective transfer deal rumoured to be worth in excess of A$1.8 million. Australisch trio tekent contractRoar cop triple blow On 22 July 2010, Adam made his Utrecht debut coming on in the 70th minute of their away draw to Tirana in the UEFA Europa League. ====Loan to Brisbane Roar==== On 20 September 2014, Sarota was loaned to Brisbane Roar for a season to add squad depth across all positions. ===International career=== On 27 August 2010, it was reported Sarota had been invited to a training camp by the Polish Football Association. Sarota's father, Tony, emigrated to Australia from Poland but said that whilst Poland was a possibility, the Socceroos were Sarota's preferred option.http://www.tribalfootball.com/fc-utrecht%E2%80%99s-sarota-targeted- poland-1073231 Sarota received his first Socceroos call up by coach Holger Osieck for a friendly match against Germany played on 27 March 2011. He made his international debut for Australia in August 2011, coming on as a substitute for FC Utrecht teammate Michael Zullo in a win over Wales.
